title: Language, Religion and Print Cultures in the Welsh diaspora
abstractText: This network examines the formation of identity in the Welsh diaspora, focusing on the intersection of language, print culture and religion in communities in North and South America after 1800. The Welsh-English experiences of North America will be compared with the Welsh-Spanish experiences of South America, making use of conceptual approaches from a variety of disciplines and comparisons with other migrant groups in the USA. The focus will be the ways in which immigrants and their descendants employed a variety of linguistic, cultural and religious resources as part of the process of constructing and negotiating identity in the diaspora.
